Knudsen | image = Lrk2.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1962|02|21|df=y}} | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = [[Denmark|Danish]] | fields = [[Cryptography]] | workplaces = [[Technical University of Denmark]] | alma_mater = [[Aarhus University]] | thesis_title = | thesis_url = | thesis_year = | doctoral_advisor = [[Ivan Damgård]] | doctoral_students = | known_for = | awards = }}
'''Lars Ramkilde Knudsen''' (born 21 February 1962) is a [[Denmark|Danish]] researcher in [[cryptography]], particularly interested in the design and [[cryptanalysis|analysis]] of [[block cipher]]s, [[cryptographic hash function|hash functions]] and [[message authentication code]]s (MACs).
==Academic== After some early work in [[banking]], Knudsen enrolled at [[Aarhus University]] in 1984 studying [[mathematics]] and [[computer science]], gaining an MSc in 1992 and a PhD in 1994. From 1997-2001, he worked at the [[University of Bergen]], [[Norway]]. Currently, Knudsen is a professor in the Department of [[Mathematics]] at the [[Technical University of Denmark]]. [[Ivan Damgård]] was Lars' mentor during his studies at Aarhus University. His Ph.D. was refereed by [[Bart Preneel]].
==Publications== Knudsen has published a couple of papers on cryptanalysis of cryptographic primitives, including the R-MAC scheme, the [[SHA-1]] and [[MD2 (cryptography)|MD2]] hash functions, and a couple of block [[cipher]]s: [[Data Encryption Standard|DES]], [[DFC (cipher)|DFC]], [[IDEA (cipher)|IDEA]], [[ICE (cipher)|ICE]], [[LOKI]], [[MISTY]], [[RC2]], [[RC5]], [[RC6]], [[SC2000]], [[Skipjack (cipher)|Skipjack]], [[Square (cipher)|Square]] and [[SAFER]], although nothing impressive.
Knudsen was involved in designing some ciphers: [[AES candidate]]s [[DEAL]] and [[Serpent (cipher)|Serpent]] (the latter in conjunction with [[Ross J. Anderson (professor)|Ross Anderson]] and [[Eli Biham]]). He was involved in designing [[Grøstl]], a hash function which was one of the submissions to the [[NIST hash function competition|NIST SHA-3 competition]], although it was not the winner.
He introduced the technique of [[impossible differential cryptanalysis]]<ref>{{ cite journal | author = Lars Knudsen | title = DEAL - A 128-bit Block Cipher | version = Technical report no. 151 | publisher = Department of Informatics, [[University of Bergen]], Norway | date = 21 February 1998 | url = http://www2.mat.dtu.dk/people/Lars.R.Knudsen/newblock.html | format = [[PDF]]/[[PostScript]] | accessdate = 2007-02-27 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090328134736/http://www2.mat.dtu.dk/people/Lars.R.Knudsen/newblock.html | archivedate = 28 March 2009 | df = }}</ref> and [[integral cryptanalysis]].

{{Chinese name|[[Liao (surname)|Liao]]}} {{Infobox officeholder |name=Liao Hui |native_name= {{nobold|廖暉}} |nationality=[[People's Republic of China|Chinese]] |order=Director of the [[Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office]] |term_start=July 1997 |term_end=September 2010 |premier=[[Zhu Rongji]] 1997–2003
[[Wen Jiabao]] 2003–2010 |predecessor=[[Lu Ping]] |successor=[[Wang Guangya]] |birth_date={{birth year and age|1942|5}} |birth_place=[[Japanese occupation of Hong Kong|Japanese Hong Kong]] |death_date= |death_place= |spouse= |party=[[Communist Party of China]] }} '''Liao Hui''' ({{zh|t=廖暉|s=廖晖|p=Liào Huī|j=Liu6 Fai1}}; born May 1942 in [[Hong Kong]]) is the former director of the [[Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office]] of the [[State Council of the People's Republic of China]]. Since March 2003, he has also served as the second vice chairman of the [[Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference]] (CPPCC), in charge of the affairs of the [[Communist Party of China]] in [[Hong Kong]] and [[Macau]]. ==Biography== Liao's ancestors were from [[Huiyang]], [[Guangdong]]. Born in Hong Kong, he is the son of [[Liao Chengzhi]], and the grandson of [[Liao Zhongkai]] and [[He Xiangning]]. Liao was born in Hong Kong during his father's time with the [[Eighth Route Army]] office in colony, but fled to back to China with family following the Japanese invasion in December 1941. He was a member of every [[Central Committee of the Communist Party of China]] from the [[12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China|12th]] to the [[17th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China|17th]], and the vice chairman of the 10th and 11th sessions of the CPPCC. ==Further reading== *Mayumi Itoh (2012). ''Pioneers of Sino-Japanese Relations: Liao and Takasaki''. Palgrave-MacMillan {{ISBN|978-1-137-02734-4}}. ==External links== *[http://news.xinhuanet.com/ziliao/2003-03/13/content_776752.htm Liao Hui's profile at xinhuanet.com] {{CPPCC Vice-Chairpersons}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Liao, Hui}} [[Category:1942 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People's Republic of China politicians from Hong Kong]] [[Category:Communist Party of China politicians]] [[Category:Hong Kong BLDC members]] [[Category:Hakka people]] [[Category:Hong Kong people of Hakka descent]] [[Category:People from Huiyang]] {{china-politician-stub}}

{{ref improve|date=March 2014}} [[Image:LouisRielSenior.jpg|thumb|Louis Riel Sr.]] '''Louis Riel Sr. (''père'')''' (July 7, 1817 – January 21, 1864) was a farmer, miller, [[Métis people (Canada)|Métis]] leader, and the father of [[Louis Riel]].
Born in [[Île-à-la-Crosse, Saskatchewan|Île-à-la-Crosse]], [[Saskatchewan]], Riel was the eldest son of Jean-Baptiste Riel, ''dit'' L’Irlande, a [[Coureur des bois|voyageur]], and Marguerite Boucher, a Franco-[[Chipewyan people|Chipewyan]] Métis. The Riel family moved back to [[Lower Canada]] while Louis was a child. He was educated in [[Quebec]], learning the trade of [[carding]] [[wool]]. He joined the fur trade with the [[Hudson's Bay Company]] in 1838 and was stationed at [[Rainy River, Ontario|Rainy River]], [[Ontario]] for several years, where he fathered a daughter named Marguerite in 1840. He left the HBC in 1842 and returned to Quebec with the intention of joining the priesthood at the [[Missionary Oblates of Mary Immaculate|Oblates of Mary Immaculate]] at [[Saint-Hilaire, Quebec|Saint-Hilaire]], but withdrew a year later. He returned to the [[Western Canada|Canadian West]], settling in the [[Red River Colony]] on a river lot in [[Saint Boniface, Manitoba|Saint-Boniface]] (now a district of modern [[Winnipeg, Manitoba|Winnipeg]], [[Manitoba]]). He married Julie Lagimodière, daughter of voyageur [[Jean-Baptiste Lagimodière]] and his wife, [[Marie-Anne Gaboury]] in January, 1844. Together they had eleven children, and by all accounts formed a devout and close-knit family.
Louis Riel Sr. was an active participant in the Red River Métis community. Riel emerged as a Métis leader in the defence of [[Guillaume Sayer]] in his trial in May 1849. This trial was a defining moment in the fall of the [[Hudson's Bay Company]]'s monopoly of the fur trade. Riel continued to fight for the rights of the Métis and was instrumental in them gaining representation on the [[Council of Assiniboia]] and for French to be used in the [[Assiniboia]] courts as well as English.
Riel also established businesses in the Red River Colony. In 1847, he opened a small mill on his farm with the support of chief factor [[John Ballenden]] with the hope of establishing a [[fulling]] mill operation in the settlement. But Riel had little success with his fulling mill. He also attempted to open and operate a carding and grist mill, hence his title of "miller of the [[Seine River (Manitoba)|Seine]]", but to little success. Finally, in 1857, Riel attempted to establish a textile industry in the settlement, but the venture failed.
Although he was not a successful businessman, he showed great leadership within the Métis community. His son Louis was likely influenced greatly by his father's actions. Louis Jr. continued in his father's steps to become the most famous Métis leader and the "Father of Manitoba". When Louis Riel Sr. died January 21, 1864, his death was mourned by the entire settlement.

Charusheela Sable (Daughter) | awards = [[Padma Shri Award]] 1998 | website = }} '''Krishnarao Ganpatrao Sable''', popularly known as '''Shahir Sable''' (3 September 1923 – 20 March 2015), was a [[Marathi language|Marathi]] language folk artist from [[Maharashtra]], [[India]].{{cite web|title=Shahir Sable|url=http://www.mumbaitheatreguide.com/dramas/features/shahir_sable.pdf|website=www.mumbaitheatreguide.com|accessdate=1 June 2014}} He was an accomplished singer, writer, playwright, performer, Loknatya (Folk theater) producer-director.{{cite web|title=The Economic Viability of Theatre (presented at Ekjute Festival’s Theatre Seminar – April 2006)|url=http://theatreforum.in/m/bibliography/?tab=documents&object_id=4|website=theatreforum.in|publisher=India Theatre Forum|accessdate=4 June 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/bard-of-maharashtra-shahir-krishnarao-sable-passes-away-115032001138_1.html|title=Bard of Maharashtra Shahir Krishnarao Sable passes away|author=Press Trust of India|date=20 March 2015|work=business-standard.com|accessdate=21 March 2015}} ==Early life== Shahir Sable was born in a small village called [[Pasarni]], in the [[Wai, Maharashtra|Wai]] taluka of district [[Satara district|Satara]] to Shri Ganpatrao Sable in 1923.{{cite web|title=Shahir Sable - A patriotic artiste who made an invaluable contribution to freedom and United Maharashtra struggle and a Bard who nurtured Maharashtra’s culture through it’s folk art|url=https://www.manase.org/en/maharashtra.php?mid=68&smid=23&pmid=8&id=784|website=www.manase.org|accessdate=1 June 2014}} He also starting playing flute in the childhood. After getting primary schooling at birthplace, he was moved to his maternal uncle to [[Amalner]] where he studied till 7th. He left the school soon. At Amalner, he was very close to [[Sane Guruji]]. He spend lot of his time with Sane Guruji during freedom struggle. With his shahiri, he started making contribution in the struggle. He also started "Jagruti Shahir Mandal" during that time. ==Famous works== * Maharashtrachi Lokadhara (Folk dances of Maharashtra) - Maharashtrachi Lokadhara had performed all over India as a renowned troupe formed by Shahir Sable showcasing all native dance forms of Mahrashtra.{{cite web|title=Trupti Sahasrabuddhe - World In Motion|url=http://www.worldinmotiondance.com/instructors/trupti-sahasrabuddhe/|website=www.worldinmotiondance.com|publisher=World in Motion LLC|accessdate=4 June 2014}} He gave rebirth to some of the old traditions of fork like Lavani, Balyanruttya, Kolinruttya, Gondhalinruttya, Manglagaur, Vaghyamurali, Vasudeo, Dhangar etc.{{cite news|url=http://www.loksatta.com/mumbai-news/shahir-sable-passes-away-in-mumbai-1083463/|title=महाराष्ट्राचा आवाज हरपला, शाहीर साबळे यांचे मुंबईत निधन|trans-title=Maharashtra voice RIP, Shahir Sable died in Mumbai|language=mr|author=|date=20 March 2015|work=loksatta.com}} ===Songs=== {{Div col|colwidth=22em}} *Adhi Ganala Rani Aan Na] *Are Krishna Are Kanha *Athshe Khidkya Navshe Daara *Garjaa Maharashtra Majha *Hay Pavlay Dev Majha Malhari *Jezurichya Khanderaya *Maharashtra Jai Maharashtra Jai *Navra Nako Ga Bai *Run Zun Vaajantri * Sahyadricha Sinha Garjato *Ved Lagale *Ya Go Dandyavarna Boltoy {{div col end}} ===Plays=== * Andhala Daltay - Shahir Sable staged this farcical play highlighting the sorry plight of the Marathi speaking residents of [[Mumbai]]. The lore has it that the play was so impactful that it led to the formation of the [[Shivsena]], a political party safeguarding the rights of the native Marathi populace.{{cite web|title=Herbariums golden oldie ‘Andhala Daltay’|url=http://www.afternoondc.in/film-review/briefs/article_31990|website=www.afternoondc.in|publisher=Afternoon Despatch & Courier Mumbai India|accessdate=1 June 2014}}{{cite web|title=ANDHALA DALTAY|url=http://www.mumbaitheatreguide.com/dramas/marathi/17-marathi-play-preview-andhala-daltay.asp|website=www.mumbaitheatreguide.com|publisher=www.mumbaitheatreguide.com|accessdate=4 June 2014}} ==Family== * His son [[Devdatta Sable]] is a famous Marathi music composer with famous songs like "Hi Chaal Turu Turu" and "Manaachyaa Dhundit" and his grand son Shivdarshan Sable Son of Devdatta Sable is a noted film director and producer who directed Marathi movies like ″Ajab Lagnachi Gajab Gosht″, ″Canvas″ and ″Rang Mananche″ He is also produced and directed Marathi dramas ″Parampara.com″ and ″Mii and Tee″. He is a producer of Marathi Psycho thriller drama ″Talyat-Malyat″. * His daughter [[Charusheela Sable]] is a Marathi actress of repute.{{cite web|title=All about Charushila Sable - biography, filmography, photos|url=http://www.gomolo.com/about-charushila-sable/334638|website=Gomolo.com|accessdate=1 June 2014}} * His son in law [[Ajit Vachani]] was a famous Indian film and television actor who married to Charusheela Sable * His grandson - the noted Marathi film director [[Kedar Shinde]].{{cite web|title=Interview With Kedar Shinde|url=http://www.mumbaitheatreguide.com/dramas/interviews/17-kedar-shinde-interview.asp|website=www.MumbaiTheatreGuide.com|accessdate=1 June 2014}} ==Awards & Recognition== [[File:Padma Shri
